meanings.definition: The act of slowing down or reducing speed.
meanings.sent1: The deceleration of the car was noticeable as it approached the red light.
meanings.sent2: The deceleration of the train before reaching the station was smooth.
meanings.sent3: The deceleration of the snail in the race made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The deceleration of time during a captivating moment can feel surreal.
meanings.sent5: The deceleration of the waterfall's flow created a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The rate at which something slows down.
meanings.sent1: The deceleration of the roller coaster at the curve was thrilling.
meanings.sent2: The deceleration of the airplane during landing was gradual.
meanings.sent3: The deceleration of the sloth climbing down the tree was comical.
meanings.sent4: The deceleration of the music tempo added depth to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The deceleration of the rocket's speed was crucial for a safe landing.
